title.narrative: HIAS Psychosocial Assistance, Livelihoods & Durable Solutions Program for Colombian Refugees in Venezuela

description.narrative: HIAS’ program seeks to improve durable solution responses for Colombian refugees through direct therapeutic activities, psychosocial support, job skills development, capacity building, support for integration into local communities, and other assistance during the resettlement process.

Objective 1: To improve the mental health of Colombian refugees by providing psychosocial support designed to alleviate the trauma and related effects of violence and abuse suffered as well as the difficulties faced during their search for durable solutions.
Objective 2: To improve access to durable solutions through the provision of orientation, information, and specific direct assistance.
Objective 3: To build and strengthen the capacity of national and local private and public organizations to address the population needs and guarantee the fulfilment of their rights and access to services.
Objective 4: To promote access to dignified livelihoods (formal employment or income generation activities) through vocational training and development of job skills.
Objective 5: To assist in the integration of refugee populations into local host community through community engagement outreach and informal educational activities.

Particularly vulnerable refugees and families receive individual psychosocial support from psychologists. HIAS psychologists identify and monitor such cases, which include those with specific needs as survivors of GBV, survivors of torture, unaccompanied and separated minors, single mothers, women at risk, the sick, and the elderly, disabled people, victims of discrimination because of their gender identity, other minorities, and people with legal and/or physical protection needs.
